thread.title: Tonight Show host Jimmy Fallon to be honoured by Harvard Lampoon on Saturday
thread.title_full: Tonight Show host Jimmy Fallon to be honoured by Harvard Lampoon on Saturday

author: News Staff
title: Tonight Show host Jimmy Fallon to be honoured by Harvard Lampoon on Saturday
text:
Posted Oct 24, 2015 12:46 pm EDT Last Updated Oct 24, 2015 at 1:20 pm EDT 
CAMBRIDGE, Mass. – Jimmy Fallon is getting the royal treatment at Harvard. 
The Tonight Show host and Saturday Night Live alum is being honoured Saturday by the Harvard Lampoon, the country’s oldest continuously published humour magazine. 
The magazine is awarding Fallon its Elmer Award for Excellence in Humor. 
The Harvard Lampoon’s Facebook page says the comedian will be crowned “Emperor of Comedy” and paraded through Harvard Square in a Roman chariot. The parade will start by the Inn at Harvard and end at the steps of the magazine’s headquarters, Lampoon Castle. 
It’s just the seventh time the undergraduate organization says it has bestowed the honour. Previous recipients include Jay Leno, John Cleese and Robin Williams. 
The 41-year-old Fallon took over The Tonight Show from Leno last year. Join the conversation Sign in to comment (not connected to your Insider Club login). You're logged in as Loading profile...
